org.bk.ass.query

Class PositionQueries<U>

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.AbstractCollection<U>
      • org.bk.ass.query.PositionQueries<U>
  • Type Parameters:
    U -
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<U>, java.util.Collection<U>

    public class PositionQueries<U>
extends java.util.AbstractCollection<U>
    Collection with fast 2D lookups.

    • Constructor Summary

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean add(U u)
      Adds the given element, the internal data structure will not be changed - query performance will suffer.
      java.util.Collection<U> inArea(int ax, int ay, int bx, int by)
      Returns all elements in the given rectangular area, including those on the border.
      java.util.Collection<U> inArea(int ax, int ay, int bx, int by, java.util.function.Predicate<U> criteria)
      Returns all elements matching the given criteria in the given rectangular area, including those on the border.
      java.util.Collection<U> inRadius(int x, int y, int radius)
      Returns all elements in the given radius, including those on the border.
      java.util.Collection<U> inRadius(int x, int y, int radius, java.util.function.Predicate<U> criteria)
      Returns all elements matching the given criteria in the given radius, including those on the border.
      java.util.Collection<U> inRadius(U u, int radius)
      Returns all elements in the given radius around the given element, including those on the border.
      java.util.Collection<U> inRadius(U u, int radius, java.util.function.Predicate<U> criteria)
      Returns all elements matching the given criteria in the given radius around the given element, including those on the border.
      java.util.Iterator<U> iterator() 
      U nearest(int x, int y)
      Returns the element nearest to the given position.

      Returns the element nearest to the given position.

      Returns the nearest element to the given position, matching the given criteria.
      U nearest(int x, int y, java.util.function.Predicate<U> criteria)
      Returns the nearest element to the given position, matching the given criteria.
      boolean remove(java.lang.Object o)
      Removes the given element, the internal data structure will not be changed - queries will therefore not be faster.

    • Method Detail

      • nearest

        public U nearest(int x,
                 int y)
        Returns the element nearest to the given position. If multiple elements have the same distance, returns any one of them.

      • nearest

        public U nearest(int x,
                 int y,
                 java.util.function.Predicate<U> criteria)
        Returns the nearest element to the given position, matching the given criteria. If multiple matching elements have the same distance, returns any one of them. The given criteria might be called often, make sure it is fast!

      • nearest

        public U nearest(int x,
                 int y,
                 int maxRadius)
        Returns the element nearest to the given position. If multiple elements have the same distance, returns any one of them.

      • nearest

        public U nearest(int x,
                 int y,
                 int maxRadius,
                 java.util.function.Predicate<U> criteria)
        Returns the nearest element to the given position, matching the given criteria. If multiple matching elements have the same distance, returns any one of them. The given criteria might be called often, make sure it is fast!
